alert.note: Alert for Coastal Charlotte; Coastal Lee; Coastal Sarasota; DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Inland Charlotte; Inland Hillsborough; Inland Manatee; Inland Sarasota; Polk (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Highlands, Hardee, Manatee, Charlotte, southern Polk, southeastern Hillsborough, DeSoto, northwestern Lee and Sarasota Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Kissimmee Prarie Preserve to 8 miles northwest of Lake Placid to 7 miles west of Ona. Movement was southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cape Coral, North Port, Sarasota, Punta Gorda, Sebring, Avon Park, Arcadia, Wauchula, Lake Placid, Port Charlotte, Lake Istokpoga, Greater Sun Center, South Gate Ridge, Lake Sarasota, Babcock Webb Wma, Gulf Gate Estates, The Meadows, Babcock Ranch, Venus and Pineland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central, central, southwestern and west central Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Charlotte; Coastal Lee; Coastal Sarasota; DeSoto; Hardee; Highlands; Inland Charlotte; Inland Hillsborough; Inland Manatee; Inland Sarasota; Polk
